The Central line is one of the longest lines on the London Underground, spanning over 74 kilometers (46 miles) and serving 49 stations It runs from Epping in the east to West Ruislip in the west, passing through the city center and many densely populated areas While there are other lines that have longer individual station-to-station distances, such as the Metropolitan line, the Central line has the longest overall distance between its two terminus stations Therefore, with a high degree of confidence, the proposed answer is true

The Metropolitan Line is one of the longest lines on the London Underground, stretching from Aldgate in the City of London to Amersham in Buckinghamshire, a distance of approximately 41 miles (66 km) However, there are other lines that come close to this distance, such as the Central Line, which runs from Epping in Essex to West Ruislip in Hillingdon, a distance of approximately 38 miles (61 km) Therefore, while the Metropolitan Line is likely the longest, I would not be completely confident in this answer without further research or confirmation
